commentary_data: Can't get enough of this, can you? Such hectic stuff over the last few days with one thriller after another, and you keep coming back for more. IPL season is well and truly on. Hello and welcome to our coverage of Match 18 of the tournament. It's Punjab Kings taking on defending champs Gujarat Titans in Mohali. Both teams have had identical results so far, winning their first two matches before losing the third. Now it's time to go their separate ways.

Gujarat come into this game after being on the receiving end of the most incredible IPL heist. They were on course for a third straight win before Rinku Singh happened. And the rest is history. They'll be eager to bounce back quickly, and will be glad to have Hardik Pandya back. The Gujarat captain missed the previous game as he was unwell, but he returns today.

Punjab were dismal with the bat in their previous game and even one of Shikhar Dhawan's best IPL knocks couldn't bail them out. The arrival of Liam Livingstone might just be the boost they need to ease the burden on their top three who have done all of the heavy lifting so far. Punjab also have the option to bring in Kagiso Rabada for Nathan Ellis.

"The pitch is an absolute beauty, not for the bowlers but for the batters," says Murali Karthik. "Quite a good covering of grass here," adds Chris Morris. "Would probably look to bowl first. Big ground, lots of pockets, and batters will have to do a lot of running."
One of the square boundaries is 74 meters, and the other one is 67 meters today. Straight down the ground is 74 meters on one end.

Feels good to play at this venue, we have had some good games here, and also a few bad ones. As a player I enjoy a lot playing at this ground and I'm also enjoying playing for Gujarat Titans. For the first time, Gujarat is playing at different grounds and different pitches across India. I was the Player of the Match the first time I played in Mohali. Lot of memories here. I always try to focus on my strengths, the size of the grounds doesn't matter. I try to bowl in right areas. I have worked on my batting and I get a lot of opportunity at the Titans (in the nets and in the match).

Happy that I have been contributing for the team. We are not going with the results, we are focusing on what things to be done right, taking forward according to that. Getting used to the situation, adapting to different conditions, different bowlers and how to tactically move forward, I am learning those things with every game. I haven't played with Kohli yet, but I will enjoy talking to him once we play against them (RCB). I had a conversation with Kane Williamson as well, picking up things from great minds. Very happy to have conversations with such legends of the game, grateful for these opportunities.

Hope GT doesnt drop Yash Dayal... Stuart Broad and Ben Stokes went on to lead England after their nightmare overs in T20 WCs. Not comparing Dayal with those 2 but want to explain that one bad over cant define a bowler's career !!
Here's some news for you. . He receives his cap in the huddle and is congratulated by his teammates. Mohit has a good record against Dhawan, getting him out four times in 10 innings.
Dhawan and Hardik are ready and waiting for the toss. Heads is the call from Hardik. And it's heads.

Bowling first. Just looks like a good wicket, and from whatever I've seen it's good to chase. Was a one-in-a-million defeat. We are a kind of team that takes it with a smile. Played good cricket until that last over. It happens. It's a fresh game. We'll come out and smile, and throw some punches. I don't know (any changes?). It's there in the paper.

Doesn't bother us. Were looking to bowl first. We have been playing good cricket. Quite normal to go through this in cricket. Won't be the first time or the last (loss against SRH). Looking forward to put up a great show.
(Playing XI): Wriddhiman Saha(w), Shubman Gill, Sai Sudharsan, Hardik Pandya(c), David Miller, Rahul Tewatia, Rashid Khan, Alzarri Joseph, Mohammed Shami, Mohit Sharma, Joshua Little
(Playing XI): Prabhsimran Singh, Shikhar Dhawan(c), Matthew Short, Bhanuka Rajapaksa, Jitesh Sharma(w), Sam Curran, Shahrukh Khan, Harpreet Brar, Kagiso Rabada, Rishi Dhawan, Arshdeep Singh

Punjab Kings have brought in Rajapaksa and Rabada. No Livingstone interestingly. For Gujarat, Yash Dayal has made way for Mohit Sharma. Vijay Shankar is not named in the XI and will most likely be their impact sub.

Mustafa Moudi  His (Yash's) numbers are not impressive even if you take that over out of the equation. He has an economy of sub-par 9 and is not an out-and-out wicket-taker either. I am not being a hater, but the sentiment is part of sports but numbers dont lie!!!
Vijay Shankar, Shivam Mavi, Jayant Yadav, Abhinav Manohar, Srikar Bharat.
Sikandar Raza, Harpreet Singh Bhatia, Rahul Chahar, Atharva Taide, Gurnoor Brar.
So we're all set to go. Shami is at the top of his mark. Two slips in place.
Shami to Prabhsimran, no run, good length delivery with a hint of outswing, line is just outside off and Prabhsimran hangs back to defend
Shami to Prabhsimran, no run, good length delivery with a hint of outswing, line is just outside off and Prabhsimran hangs back to defend
Shami to Prabhsimran,  Caught!!

Shami to Prabhsimran,  Caught by Rashid Khan!! Two ducks in a row for Prabhsimran! He looks so disappointed as he throws his head back before starting the long walk back! This isn't the greatest of deliveries either. An inswinger that's straying on leg stump, Prabhsimran tries clipping it off the back foot but he fails to keep it down. Goes straight to midwicket. Brilliant start for Gujarat Titans as Shami continues to take wickets with the new ball.
Shami to Short, no run, back of a length on middle, Short tries to pull but it doesn't bounce as high as he thought it would. It sneaks under him and strikes the back thigh
Shami to Short, , nicely punched through point! Good length delivery shaping away outside off, Short hangs back and firmly punches through point. Did play away from the body though
Shami to Short, , short of length delivery into the body, not much height on it to trouble Short and he pulls it firmly through square leg for back-to-back fours!
Going forward GT should have Rahul Tewatia as the substitute and play Vijay Shankar in the 11.. Vijay Shankar is a very good fielder and can bowl few overs as well.
Shami to Short, no run, back of a length on middle, Short hangs back and blocks down the pitch
This is Mohit Sharma's first IPL game since 2020, his last outing too, was against PBKS (for DC, Dubai)
Joshua Little to Dhawan, no run, 134.9kph, pitched right up outside off, lures Dhawan into the drive and thenB0$ The ball curves away past the outside edge
Joshua Little to Dhawan, no run, fuller than a length just outside off, Dhawan punches it crisply but finds cover

Joshua Little to Dhawan, , 133.2kph, full delivery outside off, Dhawan advances and slices it over the covers! The line was wide, and it was an outswinger, so Dhawan had to reach out for it. But he's seeing it so well with the kind of form he's in
Joshua Little to Dhawan, no run, 137.7kph, back of a length delivery slanted in on middle, Dhawan blocks it into the on-side
Joshua Little to Dhawan, no run, good length delivery swinging away outside off, Dhawan steps out, sees the ball shaping away and decides to leave it alone
Joshua Little to Dhawan, , ! Full delivery swinging away outside off, not a half-volley by any stretch, and he just plants the foot down before hammering it through extra cover
Shami to Short, no run, 140.7kph, short of length outside off, there's width on offer for Short and he throws his hands at it, crunching it straight to cover
Shami to Short, no run, ! Back of a length delivery just outside off, an outswinger that pitches and cuts in off the seam. Goes right through Short as he plays across the line
Cannot believe Punjab dropped Ellis for Rabada straightaway, should have given him a few more matches considering his good performances.
Shami to Short, , straying down leg, Short doesn't get anything on it
Shami to Short, 2 runs, back of a length on middle and leg, Short shovels it through midwicket for a couple. Wasn't all that well timed
Shami to Short, 2 runs, back of a length on middle and leg, Short shovels it through midwicket for a couple. Wasn't all that well timed
Shami to Short, , 135.2kph, pitched up outside off and Short belts the drive through extra cover. Already looks like the ball is coming on beautifully!
Shami to Short, , this shot shows just how good the pitch is! Just stand and bash it! Back of a length outside off, skids through nicely and Short drives gloriously off the back foot through cover
Shami to Short, no run, back of a length on middle, Short plays across the line of it and is struck on the back thigh
Joshua Little to Dhawan, , 136kph, back of a length delivery slanting down leg, Dhawan misses out

Oh looks close. Maybe just a little too high. Hang on, Hardik has gone for the review. Back of a length delivery that cuts in sharply and strikes Dhawan above the knee-roll as he looks to clip it away. Oh,

Joshua Little to Dhawan, no run, oh looks close. Maybe just a little too high. Hang on, Hardik has gone for the review. Back of a length delivery that cuts in sharply and strikes Dhawan above the knee-roll as he looks to clip it away. Oh,  No need to go any further. But even if he hadn't got bat on it, it looked quite high
Joshua Little to Dhawan,  Caught!!

Joshua Little to Dhawan,  Caught by Alzarri Joseph!! Dhawan falls cheaply! It's his first single-digit score of the season, and Gujarat Titans are delighted! Full ball angled in, Dhawan steps out and looks to whip it over midwicket. But it's the late outswing that does him in. The ball takes the leading edge, and Joseph hangs onto a good catch running back from mid-on.
Joshua Little to Rajapaksa, 1 run, back of a length delivery outside off, Rajapaksa steers it through cover
Joshua Little to Short, no run, 143.4kph, back of a length delivery on middle, Short hangs back and blocks
Joshua Little to Short, no run, good length delivery across off, Short gets forward and knocks it to cover
Joshua Little to Short, leg byes, 1 run, 132.2kph, back of a length delivery on leg, Short looks to pull but it sneaks under him to strike the thigh pad
Alzarri Joseph to Short, no run, , full delivery slanted in around off, Short's feet don't move much as he pushes to cover
Alzarri Joseph to Short, , 146.2kph, full ball straying down the leg-side, Short tries whipping it away but misses
Alzarri Joseph to Short, no run, 148.8kph, full outside off, Short crunches it but finds cover
Alzarri Joseph to Short, , just a little glance and it races away! 148.3kph, back of a length on middle and leg, and Short helps it away fine
Alzarri Joseph to Short, , just a little glance and it races away! 148.3kph, back of a length on middle and leg, and Short helps it away fine
Little vs Short! Fascinating!
Alzarri Joseph to Short, no run, 147.9kph, good length delivery around middle, straightens a touch and Short guides it off the outside half to point
Alzarri Joseph to Short, no run, , back of a length delivery just outside off, Short steers it to point
Alzarri Joseph to Short, , 143.4kph, good length delivery down leg, Short swings and misses
Alzarri Joseph to Short, , he was waiting and ready for this length! Back of a length around off, Short hangs back and bashes the pull over midwicket for six!
Joshua Little to Rajapaksa, no run, short of length just outside off, Rajapaksa punches it to backward point
Joshua Little to Rajapaksa, , this is the fifth wide of the innings, and it's still only the powerplay! Down the leg-side, Rajapaksa swings and misses

Joshua Little to Rajapaksa, 1 run, Rajapaksa advances and finds himself in an awkward position with a short ball angled into the body! He looks to pull, gets it high on the bat and it ! Just about clears midwicket
Joshua Little to Short, 2 runs, full outside off, driven firmly through the covers and there's work to do for deep point. Easy two available!
Joshua Little to Short, , pitched up outside off, Short goes hard on the drive and hammers it down the ground. Fifty comes up for Punjab Kings in 5.4 overs
Joshua Little to Short, 1 run, mistimes the drive to mid-off this time and scampers through for one
Joshua Little to Rajapaksa, 1 run, 141kph, good length delivery straying down leg, Rajapaksa looks to glance but gets an inside edge onto pad. It's a single to short fine leg

Timeout! Looks like a brilliant pitch to bat on out there. There is some movement with the new ball, yes, but it's coming onto the bat beautifully. And Short is loving it so far. Gujarat Titans will be delighted though, having got rid of Dhawan and Prabhsimran cheaply. Punjab's top three have done most of the work for them so far this season, and their middle-order hasn't quite stepped up. That needs to change this evening.
Rashid Khan to Rajapaksa, 1 run, back of a length on leg, Rajapaksa pulls it to deep backward square
Slip in place
Rashid Khan to Short, 1 run, full on off, Short gets forward and pushes to long-on
Rashid Khan to Rajapaksa, 1 run, 93.5kph, full leg-break just outside off, Rajapaksa drives to long-off
This match will be a true test of Punjab's batting with Dhawan gone early
Rashid Khan to Short,  Bowled!!
Rashid Khan to Short,  Bowled!!

Rashid Khan to Short,  Bowled!!  Length ball just outside off, Short hangs back and looks to bash it through cover, expecting the ball to turn away. But it comes in and goes right through the gate before crashing into middle.  Incredible stuff!
Rashid Khan to Jitesh Sharma, no run, full around off, Jitesh defends this leg-break to point
Rashid Khan to Jitesh Sharma, , dragged down short on leg, and Jitesh punishes it! He rocks back and pulls it hard behind square
Alzarri Joseph to Rajapaksa, 1 run, back of a length on middle, Rajapaksa tucks it off the back foot through midwicket
Alzarri Joseph to Jitesh Sharma, no run,  Sharp lifter around off, Jitesh jumps up and then swiftly arches back to get out of the way of this thunderbolt
Alzarri Joseph to Jitesh Sharma, 1 run, short of length just outside off, Jitesh opens the face and runs it down to third man
Alzarri Joseph to Rajapaksa, 1 run, 147.3kph, pitched up around middle and leg, Rajapaksa looks to drive and mistimes it off the inside half wide of mid-on

Alzarri Joseph to Jitesh Sharma, no run, 146.7kph, short of length delivery just outside off, and it climbs on Jitesh as he looks to drive through the off-side! Can't do that against someone like Joseph who gets such steep bounce
Alzarri Joseph to Jitesh Sharma, 1 run, back of a length just outside off, Jitesh taps it to cover and charges for a single
Rashid Khan to Jitesh Sharma, , 96kph, length ball around middle and leg, Jitesh gets down low and paddles it fine. He uses the pace on it nicely and helps it away

Rashid Khan to Jitesh Sharma, no run, now tries a reverse-paddle, but has to fetch it from outside leg. It rolls through to short third. Jitesh looks for a single but is sent back, and he makes it in time
Sad to see Yash Dayal not in playing XI. GT should have given him one more chance at least. This must have shaken his confidence. T20 cricket is really cruel on bowlers
Rashid Khan to Jitesh Sharma, no run, googly on middle, Jitesh turns it to short midwicket
Rashid Khan to Jitesh Sharma, , slightly short from Rashid and Jitesh is onto it! He thumps the pull over midwicket!
Rashid Khan to Jitesh Sharma, no run, flat googly on off, Jitesh blocks it from the crease
Rashid Khan to Jitesh Sharma, no run, flat at the stumps, Jitesh punches firmly down the pitch and Rashid does well in followthrough to get a hand on it

Alzarri Joseph to Rajapaksa, 1 run,  142kph short ball just outside off, Rajapaksa arches back and ramps it in the air. Doesn't get it as fine as he wanted to, and Tewatia moves quickly at third man to his right. But it goes to him on the bounce

Alzarri Joseph to Jitesh Sharma, no run, very adventurous from Jitesh as he steps out against Joseph and looks to slog hard! ! Full delivery at high pace, Jitesh swings and misses, and it zips through to the keeper

Alzarri Joseph to Jitesh Sharma, no run, very adventurous from Jitesh as he steps out against Joseph and looks to slog hard! ! Full delivery at high pace, Jitesh swings and misses, and it zips through to the keeper
Alzarri Joseph to Jitesh Sharma, 1 run, 145kph, short of length into the body, Jitesh pulls it to deep midwicket
Alzarri Joseph to Rajapaksa, , down the leg-side, wide called
Alzarri Joseph to Rajapaksa, 1 run, good length delivery on leg, Rajapaksa tucks it through square leg
Alzarri Joseph to Jitesh Sharma, no run, 148.4kph, back of a length delivery outside off, Jitesh has a big waft at it and is
Alzarri Joseph to Jitesh Sharma, no run, 142.7kph, back of a length on middle, Jitesh hangs back and blocks

Mohit Sharma to Rajapaksa, no run, starts well with a back of a length delivery on the stumps, Rajapaksa is rushed on the short-arm jab, misses, rapped on the front pad, certainly did pitch in line but was it too high? Saha thinks so and tells Pandya and Mohit Sharma the same. Looked certainly close. Oh , fair enough
Mohit Sharma to Rajapaksa, 1 run, short of length on off, Rajapaksa whips it to deep square leg
Mohit Sharma to Jitesh Sharma, 1 run, slower ball short of length delivery just outside off, Jitesh Sharma drags the pull to deep square leg
Mohit Sharma to Rajapaksa, no run, back of a length on off, Rajapaksa steers to backward point
Mohit Sharma to Rajapaksa, , poor delivery, slower ball but short down leg, Rajapaksa waits and pulls wide and over short fine-leg
Mohit Sharma to Rajapaksa, no run, good length and tight on off, defended to the right of cover, Rajapaksa wants a quick single but is sent back in time
Shami to Jitesh Sharma, , back of a length on off, Jitesh Sharma stands tall and smashes it over Shami, straight down the ground, fine shot
Shami to Jitesh Sharma, 1 run, back of a length and nips back in to off, Jitesh Sharma heaves to deep mid-wicket and this time he is sent back by Rajapaksa in time
Shami round the wicket
Shami to Rajapaksa, 1 run, 140kph, short on the stumps, Rajapaksa turns it to deep backward square leg

Shami to Jitesh Sharma, , that's unlucky for Shami, fullish and shapes back in to the stumps, Jitesh Sharma gets forward to drive and the thick inside-edge misses leg-stump and runs away to fine-leg. Pandya is though smiling and grooving to the beats from the DJ
Shami to Jitesh Sharma, no run, short of length and tight on off, Jitesh Sharma punches it back to Shami
Shami to Jitesh Sharma, no run, short of length and tight on off, Jitesh Sharma punches it back to Shami
We are seeing a different game from Rajapaksa tonight. Usually, he gets off with a flier.
Shami to Jitesh Sharma, no run, looked like an off-cutter outside off, on a fuller length, Jitesh Sharma sees the width and throws the bat at it, misses
The run rate post powerplay has come down drastically. PBKS needs some fire power in next couple of overs if they want to post a competitive total.
Mohit Sharma to Rajapaksa, 1 run, back of a length outside off, Rajapaksa punches to sweeper cover
Mohit Sharma to Jitesh Sharma,  Caught!!

Mohit Sharma to Jitesh Sharma,  Caught by Saha!! Short of length just outside off, Jitesh Sharma punches and misses, so close to the outside-edge and the off-stump. . And it's a good review too. Saha was the one who was convinced there was an outside-edge. UltraEdge throws up a spike when ball is next to bat. Jitesh has to go.
Mohit Sharma to Sam Curran, 1 run, short of length outside off, Sam Curran cuts to sweeper cover to get off the mark
Mohit Sharma to Rajapaksa, 1 run, back of a length outside off, Rajapaksa cuts hard and straight to sweeper cover
Mohit Sharma to Sam Curran, no run, back of a length and angling away from Sam Curran who tries to run it down and is beaten
Mohit Sharma to Sam Curran, no run, short of length outside off, Sam Curran punches straight to the fielder at cover
Loud appeal for LBW turned down and . Has this pitched in line? No pitched just outside the leg-stump

Rashid Khan to Rajapaksa, leg byes, 1 run, looked to have pitched just outside the leg-stump and the replays prove it, skids on from a back of a length and Rajapaksa misses the pull, rapped on the pad but it does not matter as
Rashid Khan to Sam Curran, no run, skids on from a good length on the stumps, punched back
Rashid Khan to Sam Curran, 1 run, another flat good length delivery outside off, Sam Curran punches to sweeper cover
Rashid Khan to Rajapaksa, no run, tossed up slower and just outside the leg-stump, Rajapaksa gets forward to defend to short mid-wicket and Sam Curran does not want the quick single
Only one six so for in this inning. Excellent bowling from GT!

Rashid Khan to Rajapaksa, no run, Rajapaksa played two shots to that delivery, was shaping for a big sweep, Rashid Khan darts it quicker and slides it across, Rajapaksa then tries to run it down and misses

Rashid Khan to Rajapaksa, no run, was there an outside-edge on that? May have even been a stumping chance. Lovely googly, tossed up and on middle and leg, Rajapaksa gets forward to flick and misses, Saha fumbles and the opportunity goes
Mohit Sharma to Sam Curran, no run, good length outside off, Sam Curran drives to mid-off
Mohit Sharma to Sam Curran, 1 run, back of a length just outside off, Sam Curran flays to sweeper cover
Mohit Sharma to Sam Curran, 1 run, back of a length just outside off, Sam Curran flays to sweeper cover
Mohit Sharma to Rajapaksa, 1 run, back of a length on the stumps, Rajapaksa comes down the track and forces it to mid-off
Mohit Sharma to Sam Curran, no run, back of a length and hits the pitch hard on the stumps, Sam Curran goes for a pull and mistimes it to mid-off
Mohit Sharma to Sam Curran, no run, good length and tight on the stumps, defended back
Mohit Sharma to Sam Curran, 1 run, Sam Curran shuffles across as there's no room for him, works the length delivery to deep square leg
! PBKS have been kept quiet by excellent bowling from Mohit Sharma and the others. Mohit has given nothing away so far. GT will hope the trend continues.
Rashid Khan to Sam Curran, no run, flat and on a good length on the stumps, Sam Curran makes room to punch to cover who dives to his left to cut it off

Rashid Khan to Sam Curran, 2 runs, Sam Curran comes down the track and it's slower outside the leg-stump, Curran pushes and the thick outside-edge runs to deep point, they take the fielder on and come back for a couple

Rashid Khan to Sam Curran, , magnificent shot. It's tossed up outside the leg-stump, Sam Curran clears his front leg and then whips from there, clears the longest fence at deep mid-wicket, so much power to get elevation on that
Rashid Khan to Sam Curran, no run, lost his shape that time, trying to pull a middle-stump delivery, mistimes to mid-wicket
Rashid Khan to Sam Curran, 1 run, good length legbreak outside the leg-stump, knocked to long-on
Rashid Khan to Rajapaksa, 1 run, googly on a good length just outside off, Rajapaksa dabs to the right of short third man for one
Except for the miraculous innings by RINKU, GT are an unstoppable force and are a threat to every single team.
Punjab's middle order is too weak, they aren't able to either rotate the strike nor hitting as well.
Alzarri Joseph to Rajapaksa, 1 run, 144.8kph, full on the stumps, Rajapaksa clips to long-on

Alzarri Joseph to Sam Curran, , Sam Curran exposes his leg-stump and the Titans have no reviews left, this is fired just outside the leg-stump and a wide called, Curran heaves and misses. Alzarri Joseph not happy with that call
Alzarri Joseph to Sam Curran, 2 runs, full on the pads, clipped wide of long-on and Rajapaksa has to put in the dive to get back, which he does
The game is under Titans control for now, PBKS has to find a big over to up the ante.
Now Sam Curran reviews for a wide to a ball just outside the leg-stump. He has shuffled across and the third ump feels that it would have struck him if he was in his original position

Alzarri Joseph to Sam Curran, no run, good call from umpire Jayaraman Madanagopal and Bruce Oxenford agrees. Full just outside the leg-stump, Sam Curran shuffles across a tad and misses the heave, wants a wide and
Alzarri Joseph to Sam Curran, , this is a wide as Alzarri Joseph fires the yorker just outside the leg-stump, Sam Curran did not move to the off-side this time
Alzarri Joseph to Sam Curran, , this is a wide as Alzarri Joseph fires the yorker just outside the leg-stump, Sam Curran did not move to the off-side this time
Alzarri Joseph to Sam Curran, 1 run, fine yorker on the stumps, Sam Curran makes room and drives to mid-off for one
Alzarri Joseph to Rajapaksa,  Caught!!

Alzarri Joseph to Rajapaksa,  Caught by Shubman Gill!! Rajapaksa's torture ends. It's a low full-toss on the stumps, he flicks and finds deep mid-wicket. Gill makes no mistake. 20 off 26 is just not on in this game anymore especially with today's match situation.

Alzarri Joseph to Shahrukh Khan, , wow! SRK! What a shot. He has pulled a 147.7 short of length delivery into the deep mid-wicket stands, rocked back and leathered it, that came right out of the screws
Shami to Sam Curran, 1 run, full and angling into the pads, Sam Curran flicks and the inside-edge onto the pads rolls away to the off-side
Shami to Shahrukh Khan, 2 runs, into the blockhole, Shahrukh Khan clears the front leg and whips it wide of deep backward square leg for a couple, they check for a short run, but Sam Curran is fine
Given kind of pitch here, it is an exceptional effort from GT bowlers.
Shami to Shahrukh Khan, 1 run, full on the stumps, Shahrukh Khan blasts the loft flat and it's on the bounce to Little at long-off

Shami to Sam Curran, , that's an incredible shot. Sam Curran goes outside the leg-stump and it's a yorker just outside off, he reaches for it and gets a toe-ender that beats Saha to his left on the dive, how did he reach that from there?
Shami to Sam Curran, 1 run, full and tailing back in on the stumps, Sam Curran heaves to deep mid-wicket
Shami to Shahrukh Khan, , Shahrukh Khan has got under another one. It's not a bad ball, just a low full-toss on the stumps, SRK stays low and belts it flat and over long-on
Mohit Sharma to Sam Curran,  Caught!!

Mohit Sharma to Sam Curran,  Caught by Shubman Gill!! Sam Curran finds deep mid-wicket. The slower short ball dug in, made Curran generate all the power, tennis-ball like bounce and Curran finds Gill on the edge of the boundary with a pull.
Mohit Sharma to Harpreet Brar, no run, good yorker on off, Harpreet Brar can only dig it out to cover
Mohit Sharma to Harpreet Brar, 1 run, slower ball short ball on the stumps, Harpreet Brar pulls on the bounce to deep square leg
Mohit Sharma to Shahrukh Khan, no run, back of the hand slower ball outside off, Shahrukh Khan drives hard and straight to extra-cover
Mohit Sharma to Shahrukh Khan, no run, back of the hand slower ball outside off, Shahrukh Khan drives hard and straight to extra-cover
Mohit Sharma to Shahrukh Khan, , clever and well done. The slower ball is an off-cutter dug in outside off, Shahrukh Khan ramps and gets it wide of Joseph at short third man
Bhanuka really struggled against the hard length heavy ball. A template for other teams to look into.
Mohit Sharma to Shahrukh Khan, 1 run, back of the hand slower ball outside off again, Shahrukh Khan taps to the point region and retains the strike with that run
Joshua Little to Shahrukh Khan, 1 run, full and wide outside off, Shahrukh Khan drives wide of mid-off and Pandya gets across and cuts it off with a dive

Joshua Little to Harpreet Brar, , this is in the slot and smashed. Full on off, Harpreet Brar holds his shape and lofts straight down the ground for a biggie, over the sightscreen, Pandya still applauds Little
Joshua Little to Harpreet Brar, 1 run, fullish and angling into middle-stump, heaved to deep mid-wicket
Joshua Little to Shahrukh Khan, , the wide yorker misses its target outside off
Has SRK got run-out? Looks tight. Third umpire called for. Gone.
Joshua Little to Shahrukh Khan,  Run Out!!

Joshua Little to Shahrukh Khan,  Shahrukh Khan Run Out!! 1 run completed. Full and wide outside off, Shahrukh Khan drills it to the left of mid-off, was just one but as Pandya shaped to throw, the ball slipped out, the batters then looked at the 2nd, but Miller was there to fire in a throw on the bounce to Saha who does the rest, SRK couldn't get back and did not dive either. Caught short.
Swostik. Batting from Punjab is not up to the mark.
Joshua Little to Rishi Dhawan, 1 run,. Full outside off, driven and Dhawan had given up, Miller lobbed it and missed
Another direct-hit and this time from Saha and Rishi Dhawan is gone
Joshua Little to Harpreet Brar,  Run Out!!

Joshua Little to Harpreet Brar,  Rishi Dhawan Run Out!! Exceptional from Saha as he dives to his right and catches the inside-edge on the bounce, gets up and throws with gloves on, hits direct and catches Rishi Dhawan short. PBKS end on 153.

PBKS are at least 20 short of where they should have been. It's a good pitch and a fast outfield. But credit to GT for their bowling which was excellent. Shami set the tone with the early wicket of Prabhsimran and then Little got Dhawan. Matt Short counterpunched well and looked dangerous till he was deceived by a googly from Rashid Khan. Bhanuka Rajapaksa at 4 struggled for any rhythm and fluency and his innings bogged his side down. Mohit Sharma playing his first game this season, bowled an economical spell in the middle overs as he choked the innings with his tight line and length. Jitesh and Sam Curran too struggled to up their strike-rate and GT dominated during that period. Thanks to SRK's cameo, PBKS get to 153. Mohit and Rashid the pick of the bowlers for GT. Back for the chase in 5 minutes...

There was excitement, but also nervousness about making a comeback after a few years. Have played domestic cricket in between. Last year I played domestic returning from a back surgery. Not many people knew I played domestic. Got a call from Ashu pa to stay with the team. I thought it would be better than staying at home (about being a net bowler for GT last year). Being a net bowler is not a bad thing. Gives you a lot of exposure. The environment at GT is brilliant.
Welcome back. The players are out in the middle.  A wide slip in.
Arshdeep Singh to Saha, 1 run, short of length and shapes back in nicely to off-stump, Saha punches and the thick inside-edge rolls away wide of the stumps and he is off the mark
Arshdeep Singh to Shubman Gill, , lovely hands from Shubman Gill. Full outswinger outside off, he gets forward and reaches for it, the bottom-hand takes over and drives wide of cover
The slip goes out to a fielder on the off-side now
Arshdeep Singh to Shubman Gill, 1 run, the inswinger on the stumps now, nicely clipped to deep square leg for one
Arshdeep Singh to Saha, 1 run, short on the stumps, Saha pulls to deep square leg
A short cover in as well for Shubman Gill now
Arshdeep Singh to Shubman Gill, no run, fullish outside off, Shubman Gill gets forward to drive to mid-off
Arshdeep Singh to Shubman Gill, no run, nice outswinger, full outside off, Shubman Gill lets it go
Rabada to Saha, no run, fullish on off, Saha gets forward to defend to cover-point
Rabada to Saha, , what a shot. Fullish outside off, Saha leans into a superb cover drive that beats cover and mid-off to perfection. All timing and grace from Saha there
Rabada to Saha, no run, short of length and dug in on off, Saha is on his toes to defend to point
Rabada to Saha, leg byes, 1 run, slips it down leg, length delivery and Saha flicks and misses, takes a legbye
Rabada to Saha, leg byes, 1 run, slips it down leg, length delivery and Saha flicks and misses, takes a legbye
Rabada to Shubman Gill, 2 runs, short on off, Shubman Gill stays on the front foot, pulls from there wide of deep square leg for a couple
Rabada to Shubman Gill, , fabulous timing. Length delivery on the middle and leg line, just a clip and it speeds away wide of mid-wicket, Shubman Gill is looking in great nick already

Arshdeep Singh to Saha, , full outside off, Saha gets forward and times the cover drive, beats cover on the dive to his right, races away. Replays show that it was the slower ball off-cutter from Arshdeep Singh
Arshdeep Singh now round the wicket
Arshdeep Singh to Saha, , fullish and angling into off-stump, Saha whips in the air and gets enough to clear Sam Curran at mid-on. The boundaries continue
Arshdeep Singh to Saha, 2 runs, dug in short outside off, Saha pulls wide of deep square leg for an easy two

Arshdeep Singh to Saha, , GT are off to a rapid start. Dug in short outside off, Saha pulls and the top-edge flies away one bounce over the ropes at fine-leg. There was a fielder but he was too square

Arshdeep Singh to Saha, , fourth boundary of the over. Nothing going right for PBKS and Arshdeep Singh. On a yorker length outside off, Saha digs it out between backward point and short third man, the fielder chases and dives but Harpreet loses
Arshdeep Singh to Saha, no run,  Full slower ball outside off, Saha gets forward to drive and the thick outside-edge lands on the bounce and wide of Jitesh, who stops it with a dive to his right
GT playing on different track for sure
Saha's touch is Glorious
Harpreet Brar to Shubman Gill, , fraction short outside off, Shubman Gill latches on, cuts hard and wide of the diving backward point to his right
Harpreet Brar to Shubman Gill, 1 run, slower and tossed up on off, Shubman Gill gets forward to drive to long-off
Harpreet Brar to Saha, no run, the arm-ball on the stumps, flat and on a length, Saha makes room to cut to cover
Harpreet Brar to Saha, 1 run, fullish outside off, Saha slogsweeps to deep mid-wicket

Harpreet Brar to Shubman Gill, 1 run, good length on off, Shubman Gill punches to Dhawan at extra-cover, Saha wanted the ball to pass before going to the other end, Gill continues and reaches as the throw comes to his end
Harpreet Brar to Saha, 1 run, tossed up on the stumps, Saha comes down the track and flicks to deep mid-wicket
Rabada to Saha, no run, good length and angling into the body, Saha swings and misses, going down leg as Saha is hit on the body
Rabada to Saha, no run, good length and angling into the body, Saha swings and misses, going down leg as Saha is hit on the body
Rabada to Saha, 2 runs, short of length outside off, Saha gets forward and punches to the left of sweeper cover, easy two
Rabada to Saha, 2 runs, short of length down leg, Saha is early into the pull, the cue-ender goes to deep mid-wicket as the camera focuses on deep backward square leg, another couple

Rabada to Saha,  Caught by Short!! Good catch at deep backward square leg and Rabada breaks the stand.  Saha pulls the short of length delivery and it's to the longer boundary, Short tracks back and takes a good overhead catch. On grounds like the Chinnaswamy or the Wankhede it was six that hit. Not here.
Rabada to Sai Sudharsan, no run, short of length and tight on off, Sai Sudharsan gets right behind the line to block

Rabada to Sai Sudharsan, , Sai Sudharsan is in great nick and this shot shows. A back of a length delivery outside off, he has flayed the cut so hard into the ground that it rockets away wide of backward point
This pitch is good and Pbks have missed a chance of setting respectable total here.
Sam Curran to Shubman Gill, 2 runs, screeches of "bowling end" but the duo make it easily. A good length delivery on the pads, flicked away wide of deep square leg

GT are running away with this. Such ease and clarity in their batting so far. Could well be an early finish if Shubman Gill decides it's time to shift a gear.

Sai Sudharsan rocks back in the crease to pull it away, but picks the fielder at fine leg to perfection. Prabhsimran doesn't miss out on the opportunity as Sai Sudharsan walks back for a run-a-ball 19 almost.

game looks one-sided but no one dare switch off given what happened the past four nights.

Rabada to Hardik Pandya, leg byes, , banged in short by Rabada, Hardik Pandya goes for a pull, but the ball flicks his helmet and flies away to the third man boundary. Rabada to Hardik Pandya, ,  Got struck on the helmet on the previous ball, and this is how Hardik Pandya reacts. Rabada goes full after bowling a bouncer and the GT captain plays an exquisite cover drive to end the over with four runs

Harpreet Brar to Hardik Pandya,  Caught by Sam Curran!! Harpreet Brar has looked pretty impressive tonight. Struck a six earlier in the evening, has been economical with the ball and now he gets the big fish. Pandya looks to go big against the spinner, goes for the aerial route, but picks the fielder at long-on. Curran is not going to miss out on that as the Punjab fans get something to cheer about.

Harpreet Brar to Shubman Gill, 2 runs, end of a lovely spell by Harpreet Brar.  are his figures tonight. This was touch short and Shubman Gill worked it through mid-wicket with soft hands for a brace. Good running between the wickets by Gill and Miller
Rahul Chahar to Miller, 2 runs, flicks this tossed up delivery towards wide long-on for a brace
Rahul Chahar to Miller, 1 run, on the pads, nudged to square leg by Miller for a single

Rahul Chahar to Shubman Gill, ,  He continues to score runs for fun against Punjab in IPL. Knows most of their bowlers and also this venue. This was a loopy delivery and the opener nonchalantly lofted it over cover to bring up his half-century in style
Rahul Chahar to Shubman Gill, 1 run, slower through the air on off, driven along the carpet to long-off

Gujarat Titans in control of this chase, and Punjab will need a really special effort from their bowlers if they want to defend 34 off the final 4 overs..
Sam Curran to Miller, leg byes, 1 run, slower short ball by Sam Curran, Miller goes for a pull, but it hits his ribs and rolls towards point, and it's a leg bye taken
Sam Curran to Shubman Gill, 1 run, on a length around middle and leg, Shubman Gill flicks it to wide long-on for a single

Sam Curran to Shubman Gill, ,  Sam Curran goes short and Shubman Gill plays a powerful forehand smash right over the bowler's head. Hit it so powerfully that even Sam Curran looks impressed

Rabada to Miller, 1 run, tries to nudge this shorter delivery through the leg-side, gets an inside edge on to the pads and it's a quick single taken by the pair
Rabada to Shubman Gill, ,  Rabada goes short and Shubman Gill stands tall and dispatches it over deep square leg for a 81 metre six. Made it look so nonchalant
Rabada to Shubman Gill, 1 run, bunts this down to long-on sensibly
Rabada to Miller, no run, slower bouncer by Rabada, Miller goes for a pull, gets beaten
Rabada to Miller, ,  A short ball by Rabada and Miller swipes this away to the deep backward square leg fence. No need to run for those
Arshdeep's back into the attack, could possibly be the final over of the match looking at Gill's form
Arshdeep Singh to Shubman Gill, 1 run, shorter delivery by Arshdeep Singh, Shubman Gill stands tall and pulls it to deep mid-wicket on a bounce
Arshdeep Singh to Miller, 2 runs, slower delivery on off, Miller drives it to wide long-off for a couple of runs
Arshdeep Singh to Miller, no run, fired on middle and leg, hint of shape, Miller looks to work it through the leg-side, gets an inside edge on to the pads

Arshdeep Singh to Shubman Gill, 1 run, pitched up by the bowler on off, Shubman Gill drives it to long-off for an easy single
But this is clearly missing leg, looking at the replays.

Arshdeep Singh to Miller, leg byes, 1 run, was a yorker on leg that was tailing in and Miller got beaten due to the huge swing. Struck on the shoe and replays confirm this was comfortably sliding down leg. Nothing more than a leg bye

Sam Curran to Shubman Gill,  Bowled!! Knocked him over! And the crowd goes even louder. Length ball on off, Shubman Gill looks to heave this across the line, but the ball skids along the deck and strikes timber. Shubman Gill walks back after playing an excellent knock. Can the Kings pull it off? For Gujarat one big hits does it, but can Curran stop them?

Sam Curran to Rahul Tewatia, ,  Goes down on his knee and scoops the length ball over short fine leg to seal the deal. Punches his chest to celebrate victory does the southpaw. Cool as a cucumber under pressure as the Titans get over the line. Was proving to be an excellent over by Sam Curran, but not enough on the day

Sam Curran to Rahul Tewatia, ,  Goes down on his knee and scoops the length ball over short fine leg to seal the deal. Punches his chest to celebrate victory does the southpaw. Cool as a cucumber under pressure as the Titans get over the line. Was proving to be an excellent over by Sam Curran, but not enough on the day

Two ordinary batting performances from Punjab Kings and they have now lost back-to-back matches. Dhawan played a brilliant innings to save them from embarrassment against Sunrisers Hyderabad, but the Punjab captain failed to rise to the occasion tonight. Gujarat Titans bowlers bowled some tight lines and lengths to restrict PBKS in the middle overs, and although Shahrukh Khan struck a few late blows, they could only accumulate 153/8 in 20 overs. Mohit Sharma was pretty impressive on his IPL comeback, and as a result of his wily bowling spell, Punjab couldn't post a total that was threatening enough. In reply, Saha and Gill got them off a flying start, and although the former was dismissed within the powerplay, Gill anchored the innings till the final over. He was unfortunately dismissed by Curran in the final over, but Tewatia made sure to take them home with a nonchalant scoop over short fine leg. Stay around for the presentations..

Agree with you on that thing. We did not put many runs on the board. We have to rectify that thing going forward. Absolutely - if you see the number of dot balls, if a team plays 56 balls, you end up losing the game. Losing early wickets puts you on the back foot and we need to work on that. Very proud of the bowlers, it was not a big total and taking the game till the end was tremendous. He came for practice yesterday, he pulled his muscle and another 2-3 days, he should be good to go [on Liam Livingstone's fitness].

Very proud of the bowlers, it was not a big total and taking the game till the end was tremendous. Wicket got a bit challenging in the end. Was harder to hit sixes with the old ball. It's a big ground. Was important to keep hitting the gaps, run as hard as possible. I should've finished the match. Rahul Tewatia and Kings XI is a love story. In these type of games, there's definitely pressure on both teams. It's about trying to minimise dot balls. It was difficult for them also to score runs against old ball. Was important to have a good powerplay. We ticked that box. It wasn't a big score. Was important to keep hitting the singles. He looked good in the nets also (Mohit). He has a good yorker. He bowled magnificently with the slower one, using the boundaries. Was a great GT debut for him.

To be very honest I would not appreciate for the game to go this deep. There was definitely a lot for us to learn from this game. That's the beauty of sports, it's never over till it's over.  We need to go back to the drawing board. They bowled really well. Luckily all our batters are in good nick. We should take risks and play shots in the middle overs, need to make sure the game doesn't go so deep. The ball was getting dried up, but the wicket was a belter. Wasn't surprised when Mohit and Alzarri were bowling. He has done a lot of hard work, he has shown patience and his time has come [on Mohit]. It would have been a tough pill to swallow if the game had gone the other side. I would like to finish the game earlier, not a big fan of taking it to the last over.

We should take risks and play shots in the middle overs, need to make sure the game doesn't go so deep. The ball was getting dried up, but the wicket was a belter. Wasn't surprised when Mohit and Alzarri were bowling. He has done a lot of hard work, he has shown patience and his time has come [on Mohit]. It would have been a tough pill to swallow if the game had gone the other side. I would like to finish the game earlier, not a big fan of taking it to the last over.

I have had a good time at this venue. I thought of sticking to my variations, had a chat with Hardik in the middle overs, luckily it paid off. You need to train hard, give your 100 percent. Need to bowl according to the situation, and stick to the basics. I was given a role to bowl after 10 overs. Credit goes to the coach who has defined everyone's role in the team.

This match should have gotten over much earlier given the start Gujarat Titans were off to, but the Punjab Kings bowlers pulled things back considerably in the second half of the run-chase. Seemed a bit dragged, but Gujarat will be glad as they are back to winning ways. Punjab Kings need to sort their batting soon, else it's going to be the same old story for them. That's all from our side tonight, we'll be back tomorrow with the live coverage between Kolkata Knight Riders and Sunrisers Hyderabad. Ciao for now!
